Submodules¶

multipuzzle_solver.multipuzzle_solver module¶

class multipuzzle_solver.multipuzzle_solver.MultiPuzzleSolver(image_filenames, pieces, distance_function, puzzle_type)[source]¶

Bases: object

reset_timestamp()[source]¶

Resets the time stamp for the puzzle solver for debug functions.

run()[source]¶

Executes all steps involved in the multipuzzle solver.

Returns (List[Puzzle]):
Puzzle solutions from the solver.
static run_imported_segmentation_round(image_filenames, puzzle_type, segmentation_round_numb)[source]¶

Debug method that imports a pickle file for the specified image files, puzzle type, and segmentation round and then runs the initial segmentation starting after the specified round.

Parameters:
  • image_filenames (List[str]) – List of paths to image file names
  • puzzle_type (PuzzleType) – Solver puzzle type
  • segmentation_round_numb (int) – Segmentation round number
static run_imported_similarity_matrix_calculation(image_filenames, puzzle_type)[source]¶

Debug method that imports a pickle file for the specified image files, puzzle type, and segmentation round and then runs the initial segmentation starting after the specified round.

Parameters:
  • image_filenames (List[str]) – List of paths to image file names
  • puzzle_type (PuzzleType) – Solver puzzle type
static run_imported_stitching_piece_solving(image_filenames, puzzle_type)[source]¶

Debug method that is used to test the stitching piece solving.

Parameters:
  • image_filenames (List[str]) – List of paths to image file names
  • puzzle_type (PuzzleType) – Solver puzzle type
class multipuzzle_solver.multipuzzle_solver.StitchingPieceInfo(piece_id, segment_numb)[source]¶

Bases: object

add_solver_piece(solved_piece_id, piece_segment_id)[source]¶

After the solver is run using the stitching piece as the seed, pieces from the solved puzzle are added to the stitching piece information object.

Parameters:
  • solved_piece_id (int) – Identification number of piece in stitching piece solver
  • piece_segment_id (int) – Identification number of the segment where the piece with identification number of “solved_piece_id” was assigned in initial segmentation. This value is “None” if the piece has no associated segment.
calculate_overlap_coefficient(size_of_each_segment)[source]¶

For solved puzzle of this stitching piece, this function calculates and returns the overlap coefficient.

Parameters:size_of_each_segment (List[int]) – Number of pieces in each segment
Returns (List[float]):
Overlap coefficient for this stitching piece to all other segments
log_piece_to_segment_mapping(total_numb_segments=None)[source]¶

This logs the breakdown of pieces by mapping them to segments.

The user can optionally specify the total number of segments in the puzzle and all will be logged. If this is not specified, then only the maximum segment number this stitching piece has a piece from is logged.

Parameters:total_numb_segments (int) – Total number of segments found
piece_id¶

Gets the piece identification number of the stitching piece

Returns (int):
Piece identification number
segment_numb¶

Gets the identification number of the segment where the specified piece is location.

Returns (int):
Piece identification number
total_numb_pieces_in_solved_result¶

Gets the total number of pieces in the solved result of this stitching piece.

Returns (int):
Number of pieces that were in the solved result of this stitching piece
